place_of_publication.publication_title: Hist. & Commentat. Acad. Elect. Sci. Theod.-Palat.

treatment.description: Plants glabrous or glandular-pubescent distally. Stems 3–20 dm. Leaf blades obovate, 5–20 cm, margins shallowly and irregularly crenate, apex obtuse. Cymes often lax, compound, glandular-pubescent. Pedicels 0.5–2 cm. Flowers fragrant; sepals ascending, triangular-lanceolate, 4–10 mm; corolla yellow or red-orange, flask-shaped (inflated on abaxial side), tube 15–16 mm, lobes spreading, 8–10 mm.
treatment.discussion: Kalanchoë integra is sometimes included in K. laciniata. In any case it is a difficult complex needing more study.
